content.description:
This is the easiest route at East Animas. It has good climbing on good rock, is easy to find, and protects well. A great beginner trad lead.  Starts with a steep move to gain a nice, right-facing corner that leads to a large ledge and bolted anchor.

There are three possible second pitches that can be done from here (

Left Picto

,

Picto Crack

,

Right Picto

).
content.protection: Standard East A rack.
content.location:
Start on the right side of the

Watch Crystal

, where the approach trail reaches the base.

content.description:
​When I guide up at East A,

Yellow Pages

is often the first route we'll hop on. I've always wanted another easy route. Each time I've done

Yellow Pages

, I've looked at this section of rock and thought something could go up it.

Finally, after going up there one day and doing a free solo circuit over in the Apple Cider area, I decided to really give this line a look. It looked easy enough to solo, so I headed up.

I cleaned out the starting crack on the way up then got up to a good stance and sent some loose blocks and flakes down. Up higher, I brushed off some facey holds and slabby smears as I made my way to the

Yellow Pages

anchor.

A few days later, I returned with some buds, and we put in 4 bolts to protect the face and slab climbing.

This is a fun climb and is great for the beginning leader. A mix of gear and bolts means you'll get to plug some pieces and hang some draws. This is great to toprope or lead while you're over here ticking

Yellow Pages

.

Beta:

start 15' right of

Yellow Pages

. Follow the crack up, protecting with a medium-sized cam or a small stopper. Clip a bolt, and climb into a small recess with a great stance. Get either a small cam or a #4 in here. Continue up, trending left and clipping 3 more bolts, to the

Yellow Pages

anchor near the tree. Lower and do

Yellow Pages

.

I'm sure this route has been climbed before; however, it was fun to clean it up and establish an easier route. I think it will become a popular climb for the grade.
content.protection:
Small nuts, small to medium-sized cams, trad draws, quickdraws, and 4 bolts. A fist-sized cam is highly optional.

Use the shared 3 bolt anchor with two Metolius rap hangers at the top.
content.location:
This is 15' right of

Yellow Pages

on the right side of the

Watch Crystal

.

content.description:
Climb the same start as

Simians to the Sun

, avoid the belay ledge and then bust up the crack to a two bolt achor.
content.protection: Typical East Animas rack.

content.description:
Steve and I originally did this route without any fixed gear (the rating reflects the original state of the ascent). It was done prior to

Lucky Time Piece (aka Primate Highway)

, and so today it benefits from the bolt on the rightward traverse out of the first part of the

Simians to the Sun

crack system. In other words, it heads toward

Kong

. I broke the drill bit (which I tied off for pro) and then in desperation moved leftward along a rail to the

Simian's

hanging belay. It was a X lead at the time with a challenging series of moves along the rail. I named the route after the Heavy Weather (fusion jazz) song.  It most likely hasn't seen a second ascent.
content.protection: The runout at the traverse would currently be at least an R rated excursion.
content.location:
Start on

Simian's

/Watch Crystal Crack and after about 30 or so feet head right as if going to

Kong

, then aim for the broken drill bit and, then head left to the

Simian's

hanging belay.

content.description:
A powerful start leads to a desperate throw after the second bolt. After the crux, enjoy easier but still thought-provoking climbing to the ledge shared with

Yellow Pages

.

At this point, it is recommended to continue up

Double Exposure

. This link-up is creates an amazing 100 foot pitch of exposed arete climbing - not to be missed!

A link-up of Skyhawk Arete

Double Exposure

, and

The Black Arete

, "Black Hawk Arete" makes for one of the better arete climbs around. A 200' pitch, from bottom to top, the climbing slowly gets easier but more runout the higher you climb.
content.protection:
Gear for Skyhawk +

Double Exposure

+

The Black Arete

:

5 quickdraws, five trad draws, and singles from BD 0.3 to 0.75.

Mar

Skyhawk alone:

5 quickdraws, a double length sling and orange TCU, and singles from 0.3 to 0.75 (for the anchor), then walk off to the right or rap

Yellow Pages

.
content.location:
The arete between

Dogs of Doom

and

Yellow Pages

.

content.description: Climb the start up to the belay ledge, for some fun funky moves stay in the crack, for some fun face climbing on trad gear go right.  At the belay ledge, climb the bolted route in front of you to finish the classic climb.
content.protection: East Animas rack with some draws.

content.description:
This is the rightmost crack of the

Left Picto

,

Picto

, and Right Picto gathering. It is a fun climb with some funky moves.

Rappel the route from a two bolt anchor. Per

Cole Bellomo

: when rapping, be mindful of cracks directly under the anchor as this rap has a high potential for a stuck rope.
content.protection: Standard rack, hexes can be nice.
content.location:
Begin right below the climb after completing

Yellow Pages

. It's easier to belay from below the climb instead of at the

Yellow Pages

anchor.

content.description: Described as a classic East Animas crack climb, this takes on the obvious crack to gain a ledge.  From this ledge, belay your partner up and go to the obvious crack (5.8).
content.protection: Classic East Animas rack.

content.description: This is a short, fun, sport climb.
content.protection: Bolts, an optional small C3, and it uses the anchor of the neighboring route.
content.location: To be filled in.

content.description:
This route is typically done as a second pitch to

Yellow Pages

, however, it is also possible to walk up to it from the right.  It is the crack that starts in the center of the belay ledge.  It is an overhanging tight-hand to hand crack.  Short but good fun.
content.protection: Red Alien - #3 Camalot (extra #0.75 & 1).
content.location:
On the right side of the Watch Crystal, either climb

Yellow Pages

, or walk up from the right and the route starts from the belay ledge.

content.description:
Climb up “

Primate Highway

,” and then veer right at the bedding seam to access the “

Kong

” anchor on the ledge.

Pitch 2: from the belay, climb up past the old fixed drill bit following 12 bolts to the top of the cliff. Just after the bulge, clip a bolt shared with “

Simians

,” then look for black bolts up and right on a black rock ban. After the last bolt, you can finish on either the

Kong

anchor or the

Simians

anchor. 70m rope gets you back down just enough to the anchor at the start of the route shared with Kong.
content.protection:
Bolts and gear for

Simians To The Sun

and

Primate Highway

.
content.location:
It is located between

Primate Highway

,

Simians To The Sun

, and

Kong...

. Technically this starts at the first anchor of

Kong...

.

content.description:
Make a few big moves, and do some pumpy climbing past 3 bolts on the wall above

PMPU

.
content.protection:
Gear for

PMPU

(bring some slings for the chimney) then 3 bolts. 2 bolts already existed as an anchor, but it still needs chain.
content.location:
This is left of

DED

and above

PMPU

.

content.description:
After clipping the last bolt on

Power Glide

, place some small gear in the crack up and left, and then head left. Hand traverse under the Bonsai tree placing gear as you go. A good mono undercling helps transition you into sidepulls and underclings with good feet. Follow the feature to the no hands rest at the base of the open book on

Primate Highway

. From here, you can go to

The Kong...

anchor for easy cleaning.

After climbing

Power Glide

the climbing is only about 5.10+.
content.protection:
4 draws for

Power Glide

, single cams from #0.3-2 Camalot, maybe a small nut for

Primate Highway’s

dihedral, and runners.
content.location:
Start on

Power Glide

, and then just before the anchor, cut left toward the Bonsai tree.

climbs.name: Lucky Time Piece (submitted as Primate Highway)

content.description:
Start the same as

Simians to the Sun

, but about halfway up bust right at the roof and then go up to the belay of

Simians

. This has been said to be a little runout.

Per

David Kozak

: this route was originally climbed without fixed gear in 1985, two years prior to Bruce Lella bolting the route. On the day of the ascent, I originally attempted to climb this line on lead but chickened out and moved further right and up to a spot where I tried to place a bolt. I broke the bit (only one I had) and then tied it off and moved left along a rail to the

Simian's

hanging belay. Steve Kolarik and I called this Teen Town and rated it 10- X. We then rapped, and I cleaned and inspected the route (Primate Highway/Lucky Time Piece) and then lead it ground up without pre-placed gear. Due to its difficulty and dangerous nature, I rated the route an 11+ X.
content.protection: East Animas rack and draws.

content.description:
This is typically done as a second pitch to

Yellow Pages

.  It is also possible to walk up from the right.  The route is a slightly overhanging blocky crack that starts at the left side of the belay ledge.
content.protection: Standard East A rack.
content.location:
This is on the right side of the Watch Crystal. It starts at the belay ledge atop

Yellow Pages

. It is the left-most of the three cracks.

content.description:
Pitch 1-Use the same start as

Primate Highway

to a ledge at the top of a shallow corner, belay from this ledge.  (5.9)

Pitch 2- Follow the ramp from the ledge to some bolts.
content.protection: Bring your small stuff lots o' Aliens and small nuts.

climbs.name: Jungle Monkey
climbs.fa: bolted by Matt King. FA: Ben Kiessel

content.description:
Jungle Monkey is a bolted variation of

Durangutan

between

Durangutan

and

Jail House Monkey

.
content.protection: Bolts.
content.location:
From the ledge anchor of

Apes of Wrath

, climb

Durangutan

to its 3rd bolt, then head slightly up and right through 5 new bolts left of

Jail House Monkey

. From the 5th bolt on

Jungle Monkey

, you can either continue up and left and rejoin

Durangutan

or continue up and right to

JHM

. There is amazing rock and holds hidden underneath a jungle of lichen. It is slightly crimpy too....

content.description:
This is an alternative to starting on

Crime & Punishment

for any of the routes starting on the left side of the Watch Crystal Wall. I linked it into

Jungle Monkey

, which made for a fun pitch. Fun and kind of reachy climbing past 4 bolts puts you on a ledge where you can choose one of 4 different routes to finish on.

I am not sure of the history on this one. The shallow dihedral had some empty bolt holes from before I showed up.
content.protection: 4 bolts plus gear for whatever route you finish on.
content.location:
The start of Jungle Book is in the dihedral 10’ right of the

Crime & Punishment

start.

content.description:
Climb the same start as

Durangotang

to gain belay ledge.  From the belay ledge shoot straight up (

Durangotang

is to your left and

Apes of Wrath

is to your right) 160 feet to the top.
content.protection: Small Aliens and some stoppers are needed to protect the crack section.

content.description:
This route follows the upper north-facing arete of the Watch Crystal face. Approximately 80 feet of fairly moderate climbing from the top belay ledge of

Evolution

(or the hanging belay anchor of

Crime and Punishment

) brings you to the top of the wall. It can be done either as an extension of

Crime and Punishment

or in an 80-foot pitch from the

Evolution

/

Crime

anchors. The first ascent party linked the Imps Arete with Crime and Punishment in one long pitch to the top of the face. If you do it this way, it's best to belay at the first belay ledge 35 feet off the ground above the technical 5.11- crux of

Crime and Punishment

.

This route offers some worthy exposure and stays on the arete to the top. Most of the climbing is cruiser, but there are two 5.9 sections protected by bolts. You will need a few pieces of gear ranging in size from 0.4 to 0.75 Camalot.
content.protection: 8 bolts and 0.4 through 0.75 Camalots. Only two to three gear placements are required.
content.location:
This second pitch begins at the midpoint anchors of

Evolution

and

Crime and Punishment

and climbs out onto the main arete of the Watchcrystal face.

content.description:
This was bolted on lead, so it is a little sporty. It has a little run out at the top, you have to climb through the crux to get to the next to and last bolt. This has good crimps with powerful lockoffs and big moves over a small roof. It shares the anchors with

Doctor Doolittle

and

Push-Me-Pull-You

. Climb up and left after the last bolt around the flake. Please use good sandstone climbing skills.

I gave it 12+ to 13- rating with the suggestion of others. I would be interested in hearing others' suggestions.
content.protection: Bring finger-sized cams and one #0.75 Camalot or similar protect you until you get to the first bolt. It is runout from the last bolt.
content.location:
The route starts to the left of "

Push-Me-Pull-You

" just below the first bolt. Follow the finger crack to the first bolt. Rap from the anchor.

content.description:
Pitch one - climb crack through a roof and some brush to gain a ledge on the left.

Pitch two - climb the left-facing dihedral to a gully.
content.protection: Bring a set of nuts and cams up to #3 BD.

content.description:
Climb the same start as

Crime and Punishment

.  At the second bolt, bust left to six more bolts and a bolt anchor.  This needs one rope to descend.
content.protection: Draws.

climbs.name: Durangutan
climbs.fa: P1 & 2 Ken Trout & Bryan Ferguson, early '80s, P3 - Mark Leonard (Tim Kuss?)

content.description:
This is a three pitch classic.

Pitch one - climb the short stem corner to gain belay ledge past one bolt (10a).

Pitch two - climb past a small tree, and go for the ledge, bring your usual East A rack for this affair (10c).

Pitch three - this is a short pitch that takes you past two bolts to the top.
content.protection: East Animas rack and some draws.
content.location: Take the descent gully down.

content.description:
Begin on a shared start with "

Dogs of Doom

". Solo up to the high first bolt (this is the "R" bit) and then begin the exciting, footwork-intensive face climbing sequence on solid edges, sloping sidepulls, and classic crimps until and awkward mantle.  There is a small crack here for... maybe a green Alien? Move into more exciting face climbing that links into the upper portion of Double Exposure.  It has great movement and great rock; this does not get the traffic it deserves!
content.protection: 1 small cam above the mantel, 7 quickdraws, and 1 48" runner or normal cordelette to extend your masterpoint over the edge of the Watch Crystal (chains should be added, see the descent info below).
content.location:
This is at the right end of the Watch Crystal. It shares the start with the prominent, left-facing corner that is

Dogs of Doom

.

The other landmark: it is immediately right of

Push Me Pull You

.

TR to your delight off the newly updated anchor with Climb Tec Anchor Hooks which allow you to just clip and lower.

In the past, you would descend via the fixed line in the gully to your right or by rapping the face of the Watch Crystal.

content.description: This is on the far right of Watch Crystal Wall, and it goes around corner. It is characterized by an overhanging crimps and jugs.
content.protection: 3 draws.
content.location:
Start on

Yellow Pages

(5.6) then traverse left up to bolt. Make a move around corner.

content.description:
Climb the corner just to the right of

Push-Me-Pull-You

, starts straight up then angles to the right.  The climbing is pretty good, but be solid at the grade, as there is really not much gear to be had.
content.protection: Not much.
content.location:
This is on the right side of the Watch Crystal, just to the right of

Push-Me-Pull-You

.

content.description:
Located to the left of the East Animas classic

Push-Me-Pull-You

, this climb goes up to the obvious roof and over it.
content.protection: Bolts.

content.description:
Use the same start as

Evolution

, at the second bolt bust left and climb to the second belay of

Durangotang

.  This route has some heady runout, but it is quality.
content.protection: Quickdraws.

content.description:
This starts at the top of the second pitch of

Push-Me-Pull-You

.  This has fun climbing on good rock but sparse protection leads to the top.
content.protection: Not much. Aliens & small - medium stoppers.
content.location:
This starts from the top of the second pitch of

Push-Me-Pull-You

.

content.description:
Again gain the

Durangotang

belay ledge and then bust right to climb the bolts to the Watch Crystal belay ledge.
content.protection: Quickdraws for the 6 bolts and the 2 bolt anchor.
